MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE RATE FROM 01 AUG – 22 DEC 2025 APPLICABLE FOR NEW BOOKINGS RECEIVED FROM 01 AUG 2025 logo: NIYAMA PRIVATE ISLANDS MALDIVES Visible Elements : • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, bold, black uppercase letters. • Below "NIYAMA," the text "PRIVATE ISLANDS" appears in smaller uppercase letters, followed by "MALDIVES" in even smaller uppercase letters. • Above the text, there is a stylized red brushstroke forming a loose, upward-arching curve, resembling the letter "N" or a wave. Design & Placement : • The red brushstroke is centered above the word "NIYAMA." • All text is center-aligned. • The logo uses a monochrome (black) typeface for the text and a single red accent for the brushstroke. Analysis : • The logo combines a modern, clean typeface with a dynamic red brushstroke, possibly evoking a sense of movement, luxury, or a natural element (such as a wave), aligning with the brand identity of a private island resort in the Maldives. Summary : This set of three photographs showcases a luxury tropical island resort, highlighting its natural setting, interior design, and unique underwater dining experience. photo: Scene Overview : • The first image (left) is an aerial view of a small, lush island surrounded by turquoise blue water, white sandy beaches, and several overwater villas connected by a long pier. • The second image (center) shows the interior of a spacious, upscale living room with white furnishings, large windows, and an open view of the beach and ocean beyond. • The third image (right) depicts an underwater restaurant with floor-to-ceiling glass walls, offering views of marine life swimming outside; the ceiling is decorated with hanging white elements, and tables are set for fine dining. Technical Details : • Bright, natural daylight in all images. • No visible scale bars or on-image text. • The underwater restaurant features clear glass panels for immersive ocean views. Spatial Relationships : • The aerial view establishes the island’s isolation and layout. • The living room is oriented to maximize the ocean view, with seating facing outward. • The restaurant’s tables are arranged to provide all diners with views of the surrounding sea life. Analysis : • The images collectively emphasize exclusivity, luxury, and a close connection to the natural marine environment, with architectural and interior design elements that frame and enhance the surrounding ocean scenery. 3 NIGHTS MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE 3 NIGHTS PACKAGE WITH SEA PLANE TRANSFER

- 1. Accommodation Rate Definition - • Valid for Middle East & GCC Market Only. - • Book by period: 30th Sept 2025 - • Package rates are quoted in US Dollars and based on standard occupancy for 3 nights per villa/pavilion including return transfers for, - ◦ All Villas and One Bedroom Pavilions - Includes return transfers for 02 people - ◦ Two Bedroom Pavilions - includes return transfers for 04 people - ◦ Three Bedroom Pavilion - includes return transfers for 06 people - • Rates are inclusive of Breakfast & Dinner at Epicure or BLU subject to restaurant operations. - • Still water, tea and coffee are included during meals. - • Combinable with Honeymoon/Anniversary/Birthday - • All rates are net inclusive of 16% TGST, 10% Service Charge and Green tax based on the Standard Occupancy. - • Offer is subject to availability, stop sales and length of stay restrictions upon resort's discretion with a 48 hrs notice period. - • This Middle East Package supersedes any existing package. - • All villas are on free sale while Pavilions are on request basis. P2 MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE RATE FROM 01 AUG – 22 DEC 2025 APPLICABLE FOR NEW BOOKINGS RECEIVED FROM 01 AUG 2025 logo: NIYAMA PRIVATE ISLANDS MALDIVES Visible Elements : • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, bold, black uppercase letters. • Below "NIYAMA" are the words "PRIVATE ISLANDS" and "MALDIVES" in smaller, spaced uppercase letters. • Above the text is a stylized, red, brushstroke-like curved line resembling the letter "N" or a wave. Design & Placement : • The red brushstroke is centered above the text. • All text is center-aligned. • The overall design is minimalistic, using only black and red on a white background. Analysis : • The logo uses a simple, elegant design to convey a sense of luxury and exclusivity, with the red brushstroke adding a dynamic, tropical or oceanic element appropriate for a private island resort in the Maldives. 2. **Exclusive Benefits** - • One-time Complimentary Floating Breakfast experience during the stay for Beach Pool Villa and upwards. - for stays on Beach Villa and Deluxe Beach Villa, it will be a one time in villa breakfast experience instead. - • One-time Shisha experience either at Blu Restaurant or Dune Bar during the stay per villa. - • One-time Complimentary Lucky Dolphin Cruise during the stay - **for stays of 4 nights and above only** - • 20 mints photo session with snap studio with 02 colour corrected digital images, delivered by e-mail (no print) - **for stays of 4 nights and above only** - • Personalized bicycles for adults and children - • Tea & Nespresso facilities in the Villas - • 24 hours shared Thakuru (host) service with buggy & bookings assistance - • Popcorn machine & popcorn in the Villas - • Daily replenishment of ice cream in the Villas - • Bottles of water per villa per day - • Flip flops & indoor slippers - • WI-FI access - • Complimentary Twice a week evening yoga session - • Usage of Active facilities (Game Center) excluding private Indoor Cinema - • 24 hours fitness facility (Pump) - • Scheduled activities (i.e: Aqua Zumba, HIIT, etc) - • Access to the Tennis court - • Surfing at Vodi (exclusive surf spot at Play Island) - • Access to Lair (Library & Business Centre) with water, tea & Nespresso - • Access to the steam room and sauna at Drift Spa by Niyama - • Non-motorized water sports activities (Kayaking, Snorkeling) - • Snorkeling equipment 4. Additional Person Policy Infant stays for free (Age 0 to 1.99 years) • Stay for free. Baby-cot available upon on request and required to be booked in advance. • Complimentary meals on infant menu at all outlets. • Complimentary return Seaplane or Domestic transfer. Child (Age 2 years to 11.99 years) USD 61 charge per child per night when travelling with parents in the same room. • Accommodation with service charge, TGST and green tax as well as breakfast, lunch and dinner on kids’ menu in all restaurants (except Subsix) • Kids Club access for three age groups (Adventurers, Voyagers & Pioneers) from 9am to 6pm. Tailor made activities (explore marine life, Master Chef classes etc.). • Access to professional and fully qualified child carers recruited and trained by Scott Dunn, supported by a trained local team. Complimentary bikes. • Offers are not applicable on child fee. Third Adult (Age 12 years and above). USD 206 charge is applicable per person per night rate includes: • Service charge, TGST and green tax. • Breakfast and Dinner except Peak Season. Dinner Supplement during 23rd Dec 2025 to 08th Jan 2026 would be USD 135 nett per person per day (except 24th & 31st Dec 2025) P3 MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE RATE FROM 01 AUG – 22 DEC 2025 APPLICABLE FOR NEW BOOKINGS RECEIVED FROM 01 AUG 2025 logo: NIYAMA PRIVATE ISLANDS MALDIVES Visible Elements : • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, bold, black uppercase letters. • Below "NIYAMA," the text "PRIVATE ISLANDS" and "MALDIVES" appears in smaller, spaced uppercase letters. • Above the text, there is a stylized red brushstroke forming a loose, upward curve resembling the letter "N" or a wave. Design & Placement : • The red brushstroke is centered above the word "NIYAMA." • All text is center-aligned. • The logo uses a minimalistic, modern design with a monochrome palette except for the red brushstroke. Analysis : • The logo combines a clean, modern typeface with a dynamic red brushstroke, possibly evoking a sense of movement, luxury, or a natural element (such as a wave), aligning with the brand's identity as a private island resort in the Maldives. - • Third person is subject to maximum occupancy and bedding allocation. 5. Special Occasion Benefits

6. Meal plan HALF BOARD
Included in the rate
  • Breakfast & Dinner are available at Epicure or BLU subject to restaurant operations.
  • USD 70 net food credit per adult per night is available for dinner at Tribal, Nest & Edge.
  • Food credit is not applicable on Destination Dining, In-villa Dining, The Deli Food Truck at Surf Shack and Subsix or other special events.
**LUNCH SUPPLEMENT** USD 55 Net per person per night - • Three-course lunch (Appetizer + Main Course + Dessert) at [BLU](#) or [Dune](#) (food menu only) subject to restaurant operations. - • Option of light lunch at the Deli of Food truck at Surf Shack (up to 2 items from menu - guests choice) - • USD 55 net food credit per adult per day is applicable when having lunch at [Nest](#) Teppanyaki. **The restaurants are hyperlinked to the 360 virtual tour. ***All meal plans are combinable with any of our beverage package. 7. P4 MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE RATE FROM 01 AUG – 22 DEC 2025 APPLICABLE FOR NEW BOOKINGS RECEIVED FROM 01 AUG 2025 logo: NIYAMA PRIVATE ISLANDS MALDIVES Visible Elements : • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, bold, black uppercase letters. • Below "NIYAMA" are the words "PRIVATE ISLANDS" and "MALDIVES" in smaller, spaced uppercase letters. • Above the text is a stylized, red, brushstroke-like curved line resembling the letter "N" or a wave. Design & Placement : • The red brushstroke is centered above the text. • All text is center-aligned. • The overall design is minimalistic, using only black and red on a white background. Analysis : • The logo uses a simple, elegant design to convey a sense of luxury and exclusivity, with the red brushstroke adding a dynamic, tropical or oceanic element appropriate for a private island resort. - • The direct journey is approximately 45 minutes each way. One stopover might occur, and guest will be advised prior to take off. - • Guests will have access to the Niyama Lounge with complimentary non-alcoholic beverages & snacks (opening hours 6.30 am to 8.30 pm). - • Excess baggage is chargeable at **USD 5.80 per kg**, payable directly to the airline at the airport. - • Transfers by seaplane are available during daylight hours only. Guests arriving at Male airport after 3:15 pm shall be advised to book a domestic flight or arrange overnight accommodation and will be transferred to the resort the following morning. - • The journey is approximately 30 minutes per way + 5 minutes by speedboat. - • Price is inclusive of complimentary return speedboat transfer between Dhaalu Domestic Airport and the resort. - • Excess baggage is chargeable at **USD 5.80 per kg**, payable directly to the airline at the airport. - • International flight details must be provided **5 days** prior to arrival for High, Low & Shoulder Season. For Peak Season, international flight details must be received **30 days** prior to arrival. - • Departing guests will be transferred to the airport at least 3 hours prior to the scheduled international flight departure, with the last seaplane departing from the island at 3:00pm. - • Domestic & Seaplane transfers are managed by a third-party company thus it will be subject to availability and may be cancelled due to weather conditions or operational reasons. In this case, arrangements will be done for the guest on the next best available flight. - • Schedule of domestic flights can be communicated a week prior to arrival, while for seaplane transfers it will be communicated to the guest the day prior to their arrival/departure from the resort. - • Niyama Private Islands Maldives is not accountable for any delays or cancellations due to the local domestic flight carrier or seaplane operator. - • 100% fees will be applicable in case of no show or cancellation. - • Rate is subject to change without prior notice as per the service provider. P5 MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE RATE FROM 01 AUG – 22 DEC 2025 APPLICABLE FOR NEW BOOKINGS RECEIVED FROM 01 AUG 2025 Summary : This image is a logo for "NIYAMA Private Islands Maldives," featuring stylized text and a red brushstroke graphic. logo: NIYAMA Private Islands Maldives Logo Elements : • The word "NIYAMA" is written in large, bold, black uppercase letters. • Below "NIYAMA," the text "PRIVATE ISLANDS" appears in smaller uppercase letters. • The word "MALDIVES" is centered beneath "PRIVATE ISLANDS" in even smaller uppercase letters. • Above the text, there is a red, abstract brushstroke graphic resembling a curved line or wave. Design & Placement : • The brushstroke is positioned above the word "NIYAMA," slightly slanted and dynamic. • All text is center-aligned. • The overall logo is on a white background. Analysis : • The logo uses a minimalist design with a bold, modern font and a single red accent, likely to convey luxury and exclusivity associated with private island resorts in the Maldives. 8. logo: NIYAMA PRIVATE ISLANDS MALDIVES

Visible Elements :
  • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, bold, black uppercase letters.
  • Below "NIYAMA," the text "PRIVATE ISLANDS" appears in smaller uppercase letters, followed by "MALDIVES" in even smaller uppercase letters.
  • Above the text, there is a stylized red brushstroke forming a loose, upward-arching curve, resembling the letter "N" or a wave.

Design & Placement :
  • The red brushstroke is centered above the word "NIYAMA."
  • All text is center-aligned.
  • The logo uses a monochrome (black) typeface for the text and a single red accent for the brushstroke.

Analysis :
  • The logo combines a modern, clean typeface with a dynamic red brushstroke, possibly evoking a sense of movement, luxury, or a natural element (such as a wave), aligning with the brand identity of a private island resort in the Maldives.

Summary : This set of three photographs showcases a luxury tropical island resort, highlighting its natural setting, interior design, and unique underwater dining experience.

photo:
Scene Overview :
  • The first image (left) is an aerial view of a small, lush island surrounded by turquoise blue water, white sandy beaches, and several overwater villas connected by a long pier.
  • The second image (center) shows the interior of a spacious, upscale living room with white furnishings, large windows, and an open view of the beach and ocean beyond.
  • The third image (right) depicts an underwater restaurant with floor-to-ceiling glass walls, offering views of marine life swimming outside; the ceiling is decorated with hanging white elements, and tables are set for fine dining.

Technical Details :
  • Bright, natural daylight in all images.
  • No visible scale bars or on-image text.
  • The underwater restaurant features clear glass panels for immersive ocean views.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The aerial view establishes the island’s isolation and layout.
  • The living room is oriented to maximize the ocean view, with seating facing outward.
  • The restaurant’s tables are arranged to provide all diners with views of the surrounding sea life.

Analysis :
  • The images collectively emphasize exclusivity, luxury, and a close connection to the natural marine environment, with architectural and interior design elements that frame and enhance the surrounding ocean scenery.

2. **Exclusive Benefits**
- • One-time Complimentary Floating Breakfast experience during the stay for Beach Pool Villa and upwards. - for stays on Beach Villa and Deluxe Beach Villa, it will be a one time in villa breakfast experience instead.
- • One-time Shisha experience either at Blu Restaurant or Dune Bar during the stay per villa.
- • One-time Complimentary Lucky Dolphin Cruise during the stay - **for stays of 4 nights and above only**
- • 20 mints photo session with snap studio with 02 colour corrected digital images, delivered by e-mail (no print) - **for stays of 4 nights and above only**

- • Personalized bicycles for adults and children
- • Tea & Nespresso facilities in the Villas
- • 24 hours shared Thakuru (host) service with buggy & bookings assistance
- • Popcorn machine & popcorn in the Villas
- • Daily replenishment of ice cream in the Villas
- • Bottles of water per villa per day
- • Flip flops & indoor slippers
- • WI-FI access
- • Complimentary Twice a week evening yoga session
- • Usage of Active facilities (Game Center) excluding private Indoor Cinema
- • 24 hours fitness facility (Pump)
- • Scheduled activities (i.e: Aqua Zumba, HIIT, etc)
- • Access to the Tennis court
- • Surfing at Vodi (exclusive surf spot at Play Island)
- • Access to Lair (Library & Business Centre) with water, tea & Nespresso
- • Access to the steam room and sauna at Drift Spa by Niyama
- • Non-motorized water sports activities (Kayaking, Snorkeling)
- • Snorkeling equipment

4. Additional Person Policy

Infant stays for free (Age 0 to 1.99 years)
• Stay for free. Baby-cot available upon on request and required to be booked in advance.
• Complimentary meals on infant menu at all outlets.
• Complimentary return Seaplane or Domestic transfer.

Child (Age 2 years to 11.99 years)
USD 61 charge per child per night when travelling with parents in the same room.
• Accommodation with service charge, TGST and green tax as well as breakfast, lunch and dinner on kids’ menu in all restaurants (except Subsix)
• Kids Club access for three age groups (Adventurers, Voyagers & Pioneers) from 9am to 6pm. Tailor made activities (explore marine life, Master Chef classes etc.).
• Access to professional and fully qualified child carers recruited and trained by Scott Dunn, supported by a trained local team. Complimentary bikes.
• Offers are not applicable on child fee.

  • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, bold, black uppercase letters.

- • The direct journey is approximately 45 minutes each way. One stopover might occur, and guest will be advised prior to take off.
- • Guests will have access to the Niyama Lounge with complimentary non-alcoholic beverages & snacks (opening hours 6.30 am to 8.30 pm).
- • Excess baggage is chargeable at **USD 5.80 per kg**, payable directly to the airline at the airport.
- • Transfers by seaplane are available during daylight hours only. Guests arriving at Male airport after 3:15 pm shall be advised to book a domestic flight or arrange overnight accommodation and will be transferred to the resort the following morning.

- • The journey is approximately 30 minutes per way + 5 minutes by speedboat.
- • Price is inclusive of complimentary return speedboat transfer between Dhaalu Domestic Airport and the resort.
- • Excess baggage is chargeable at **USD 5.80 per kg**, payable directly to the airline at the airport.

- • International flight details must be provided **5 days** prior to arrival for High, Low & Shoulder Season. For Peak Season, international flight details must be received **30 days** prior to arrival.
- • Departing guests will be transferred to the airport at least 3 hours prior to the scheduled international flight departure, with the last seaplane departing from the island at 3:00pm.
- • Domestic & Seaplane transfers are managed by a third-party company thus it will be subject to availability and may be cancelled due to weather conditions or operational reasons. In this case, arrangements will be done for the guest on the next best available flight.
- • Schedule of domestic flights can be communicated a week prior to arrival, while for seaplane transfers it will be communicated to the guest the day prior to their arrival/departure from the resort.
- • Niyama Private Islands Maldives is not accountable for any delays or cancellations due to the local domestic flight carrier or seaplane operator.
- • 100% fees will be applicable in case of no show or cancellation.
- • Rate is subject to change without prior notice as per the service provider.
